title: Update versions used in workflow
body:
In the Github workflow to run the tests, we are using some outdated packages and we're not setting the python version.

actions/checkout: The latest version is v4
actions/setup-python: The latest version is v4 (already using)

We are running on python3.10, maybe we should test on 3.11 as well.

title: Protect main branch on Github
body:
It is now possible to merge to main even when the tests are failing.
SInce we now automatically deploy to https://acceptatiebredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/
let's protect the main branch and only allow pull-requests to go through when all tests are passsing

title: Update Schedules to set schedule_type
Add Teacher (again) not possible

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

body:
If you go to https://acceptatiebredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/company/teachers/ and choose "invite teacher", and add a teacher that has previously been removed, then it says "Teacher is already registered with your Company".

I think it should be possible to (re)invite a Teacher after they have been removed from a Company.

- [ ] Check if Teacher is still a member of the Company, then show current message
- [ ] If Teacher has been removed from Company, treat invitation as if it's a first time invitation

title: Check code coverage with a tool like https://coverage.readthedocs.io/en/7.3.2/
Split requirements.txt in base, local and production

labels.name: not_ready
labels.description: Issues that are not yet ready to be worked on

body:
I think we need to reconsider the whole initial setup. Requirements can be split and I think we need to get the settings right. 

It now runs __init__.py which is totally unnecessary.

Instead of one requirements file, create a requirements directory with three files:
base.txt
local.txt
production.txt

See cookiecutter django for more: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/%7B%7Bcookiecutter.project_slug%7D%7D/requirements/local.txt

title: Create feedback system

labels.name: not_ready
labels.description: Issues that are not yet ready to be worked on

body:
Have a look at https://github.com/wijnandb/django-tellme

The idea is that people can provide feedback on the site or make suggestions.
Ideal for tracking bugs, help users with any problems they encounter and work with the client to imporve the application over all.

The original django-tellme isn't working for Django 4+, which is why I forked it.

Once we have this up and running, we'll make some additions to it, like showing users the status of their bug/request/feedback, integrate with Github issues, et cetera.

title: Create and load fixtures to populate database with fake data
body:
We need an environment that is fully working, but which has fake data, so we can use it to showcase and test the application. 

Best way to do that is to use fixtures and load them. If we do that, we could even create users to view and test the different roles. They can do whatever they like, at night we reset the data (= load the fixtures again). 

We would need fixtures for:
- users 
- profiles
- schools
- activities
- skills
- rubrics
- schedules
- companies
- teachers
- financials
- enrollments
- attendance
- periods?
- faq (per role?)
- portfolio

Next to filling the application with data, we also need to start marketing and selling the application. 

Seeing who has viewed our application will greatly help, so sending login information for different roles will help us understand who is interested. 
(Visitors can ask to receive login information, which we will then send them).

title: Parents can indicate absence of Child

labels.name: Role: Parent
labels.description: Everything that is belongs to the Parent role

body:
We want to give Parents the option to indicate their child will be absent from an Activity (child is sick, has to go to dentist, whatever).

Ideally, we take that information from the school administration system, we are looking into the possibilities.

There are however situations where the Student has attended school (so nothing noted in the School administration system), but will be missing the After School program.

Idea is to offer the option to a Parent to indicate their child will be absent on a given day.

We still need to figure out where en how

labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

milestone.title: Changes to schoolmanager interface

body:
Currently the school-manager can not add or edit (or sometimes even: see) the location of an activity.

Allow them to add, edit, see and print the location of an activity.

So on https://acceptatiebredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/schoolmanager/1/activiteit/2098/future/ we should show the location, not sure whether that is done now.
And then we make the "Location:" text clickable and allow them to edit.

title: Improve auto_placement algorithm

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

milestone.title: Changes to schoolmanager interface
milestone.description: Some changes to the schoolmanager's interface, based on comments made by the "Talentmakelaars'.

body:
Related to #419

We want a (or multiple) auto_placement algorithms to place (or "finally enroll") students into activities.

There are several goals or concerns when "auto_placing": 
- optimize participation
- optimize development of Student (multiple talent_areas, multiple different activities)
- equal distribution: enroll students in popular activities only once.

We can have multiple algorithms and we can have school-managers choose between them.

For starters, we should develop a well working algorithm that, well, works.

We can even offer school-managers the choice which algorithm to choose per activity.

title: Student enrollment: avoid doubles

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
if Student is enrolled for activity A on day 1 en time x: 
unenroll them for activity B, C and D on same day and time.

Take into account the different Statuses there are for Participation status: 
        INTERESTED = 1, _('Ingeschreven')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_ENROLLED = 2, _('Voorlopig geplaatst')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_DENIED = 3, _('Voorlopig afgewezen')
        AI_ENROLLED = 4, _('Automatisch geplaatst')
        AI_DENIED = 5, _('Automatisch afgewezen')
        FINAL_ENROLLED = 6, _('Definitief geplaatst')
        FINAL_DENIED = 7, _('Definitief niet geplaatst')
        DROPPED_OUT = 8, _('Eerder gestopt')

We have an algorithm that is supposed to do this, but it works crappy, needs to be improved.

It is called auto_placement and can be found in schoolmanager/views.py

title: Create PWA/SPA for Parent role

labels.name: Role: Parent
labels.description: Everything that is belongs to the Parent role

body:
These are the current pages for the parent:
https://wijnandb.github.io/screenshots_automated/#/parent

We want the set_consent screen to be displayed immediately after login.
All screens have to be developed "mobile first".
We would like to create a optimal User experience. 

These are the things a Parent needs to do:
- see current schedule
- enroll child for new activities
- register absence for a child
- view information of a child
- edit information of a child
- see Portfolio 

Screens + information to be displayed on each screen: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hxANkJSeHLexSH_XNt5Yk8lKjyNhqTbQjMpSSzenimE/edit

We want to be able to send parents push-messages as well, for instance when placement for anctivity has been finalized, or if it's possible to enroll for a new activity.

The search using Datatables on all students of a school has been removed because loading all students was very slow.
@gurmessa Can you implement a new search function here?
Maybe use DRF in combination with HTMX https://htmx.org/examples/active-search/

MAybe have a look at https://www.reddit.com/r/django/comments/yee8l6/using_htmx_with_django_rest_framework/ as well.

It can be implemented on a new page or integrated in the current page, like described below (but not using datatables).

On https://acceptatiebredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/schoolmanager/leerlingen/2/

add a link "Alle leerlingen" that goes to a Student-list that is only filtered by school.

Don't add the number of enrollments per Student, only Names and Yeargroup.

Show using datatables.

Steps:
- create view
- create url
- create template
- add link on https://acceptatiebredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/schoolmanager/leerlingen/2/

title: add field IBAN to Company

labels.name: not_ready
labels.description: Issues that are not yet ready to be worked on

body:
To process invoices automatically, we need to have the IBAN for each company, to be added to the invoice.

In order to do that, we need to add an IBAN field to the Company model.

The structure of an IBAN is: CCxxBBBBxxxxxxxxx
x stands for a digit 0-9
CC for countrycode, like NL or BE 
BBBB stands for Bankcode, like RABO, ABNA, INGB, BUNQ, et ectera (all letters)

So for the Netherlands we are looking for a field of 18 characters and we could add a function to check if a valid IBAN has been filled out. 

Javascript check: https://github.com/arhs/iban.js

title: Horizontal scroll on Attendance page

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: Role: Teacher
labels.description: All functionality and pages related to Teacher role

body:
On the page where Attendance is filled out, we want to implement a horizontal scroll, so all dates are viewable, even on small screens. 

We also want to keep the first column fixed, so the name of the student is in view all the time. 

First get horizontal scrolling working, see [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content)

Then fixate the first column.

See also [Codepen](https://codepen.io/capnhairdo/pen/qBaGRBV)

title: Interface improvements

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: Role: Parent
labels.description: Everything that is belongs to the Parent role

body:
The website has quite a lot of terrible pages. Bad performance, bad UI, bad UX.
One way of fixing that is by using JavaScript or REACT to create some better UI/UX.
We are setting up a project where we are going over the different roles that visitors can have (parent, teacher, company, school_manager, super_manager) and go over the different tasks they have to (be able to) perform.

Based on that, we decide how we will put together the UI for each role. We might even decide to create a different PWA for the parents, taking into account that most are using mobile devices to interact with the website.

We have started monitoring website traffic, so we know how people are interacting with our website, which for parents is mainly on mobile.

@gurmessa: Please answer questions below
- [ ] What would we need to create a PWA for parents?
- [ ] Can we use Push and Notifications? For instance,
- [ ] send a notification to parents when they can enroll their children, 
- [ ] send a notification when  their children are finally enrolled
- [ ] when their child has an activity that day


Related to #416

title: Reminder mail to teachers
body:
We want to send reminders to teachers prior to the start of a Schedule, to ask them to fill out Attendance records. Let's discuss the best approach for this, we could check every hour, check once per day, we can send separate mails for each Schedule or group them per teacher.

If Attendance hasn't been filled out after 6 days, we send a reminder to the Company, so they can remind their teacher(s).

In order to test this, create a mail that says:
"Hallo,
Denk je er aan om de aanwezigheid in te voeren voor de activiteit {{ schedule.activity }} op {{ schedule.day }} om {{ schedule.time }}.
< link to attendance for this schedule >

Met vriendelijke groet,
Het team van de Brede School"

@gurmessa replied: we can use celery library to create scheduled task that a runs at a specific time . we get start time & date of a schedule, we then deduct 30 minutes ,schedule a celery task

also here we can create a scheduled a task at schedule datetime plus six days
